luFAEGyR7jdTWxfWDfRQVQ.text: After seeing the write ups on Charlotte Observer and Creative Loafing we had to try this place out. Dumplings were amazing and cannot wait to come back and try out the noodles!

vzwviUDTiB4Y0pr9P7Wg3w.text: Ah the dumpling lady! The only food I would chase. They come to my work luckily, but the dumplings are a 10/10. Any dumpling I've had there has been one I'd think about until my next visit (prob abt 10 total trips). The noodle dishes all taste the same to me and aren't as good as the dumplings (7.5/10) but are a great side w lunch combo. Note: bring water as you're in for a spicy experience!

o2hQWfFAr4kyYm4eF2zmNg.text: Highly recommend The Dumpling Lady - ordered the shrimp and chicken combo and the pork and chives when I saw her at the Atherton Market on Saturday. Easy pickup that Wednesday at NoDa's Company Store, but she offered free delivery. $12 per dozen includes a tangy soy sauce for dipping. Preparation is super easy - drop them in boiling water; when they float they are ready. Served them with white rice and sauteed vegetables and my dinner companions were thrilled! I will order them again.

EzQWMfhnGoqwTcbsOf5l9g.text: I wish I had taken some pictures to accompany this review. We had the burning noodles and two types of dumplings (pork and chive and chicken and shrimp). By far, the best dumplings and noodles I've ever had the joy of consuming....so good that we bought an order to go as we left!  I'll definitely be coming back again!

bhNp8Tk8jMpYdU5vUZ0Nkg.text: I'd buy liters of the dipping sauce if I could-- so good I could eat it on anything! Dumplings are super fresh and flavorful.

q3ZM80jH9sL8Lk_ZnJFxEw.text: Awesome dumplings.  Fun place to grab some cheap eats in NoDa. Grab a seat outside, or just wander a little while they whip it up.

8yaWu6yghuWoEDyM3k1G0g.text: The best dumplings in Charlotte , the Chinese crepe is just amaazinggggggg. Don't miss on the veggie dumplings

s8Gk37_EfWY3K6R3aiOC_w.text: These are the best dumpling EVER!   If you haven't tried pls do..   You will not be disappointed!

xaSeRTDM3bwRQtrWfxOMRw.text: I ran into the dumpling lady at her booth during the pig picking in plaza midwood. At the time I gushed over not just the dumpling, but the sauce. She was kind enough to send me home with half a cup full, which I couldn't refrain from smelling on the ride home. The next day, I marinated a filet in her amazing sauce and I'm still riding the adrenaline high. Might be the best sauce I've ever had, even in my travels to Asia. Thanks for being awesome and making awesome food.

6iSnugKg8jlgPr8pempXkw.text: It deserves a five star! Especially in Charlotte, where you can hardly find any authentic Chinese food.

GTIDBaqf08g0PH2bAZCqQA.text: I decided to try ordering from their food truck today.  They had a lunch special for $12 which was noodles and 6 dumplings.  The food smelled wonderful.  The dumpling sauce was a bit spicy to me. Fortunately I like spicy food.  Unfortunately there was cilantro in it and I'm very sensitive to cilantro.  Even a little piece will ruin the entire dish for me so I was disappointed with that.  I'm not sure if it's possible to get it without the cilantro but it may be worth asking because it was otherwise delicious.  For the noodles they were out of everything but the Dan Dan noodles.  When I took a bite they were good but a bit dry.  I then realized the sauce was on the bottom of the dish so I mixed everything up.  Once I did that the noodles were delicious but a bit too spicy even for me, which is saying a lot. Unfortunately the rest of the day my stomach has been very upset (it still is even 12 hours later).  I think it may have been all the spice or perhaps an oil they used that bothered my stomach. I'm not sure I'd try it again but if I ever do, I'd definitely order something different.

LJEctHrUxjilj5nTPAYesA.text: First lunch-break food truck of spring is akin to the vultures returning to Capistrano. Yea birds!! They pull in on the other side of the offices which means an embarrassingly short drive or a really long walk so I usually opt to dine in and save some nickels but it was so springy and dumplingy out yesterday that I had to make the trek. A happy face helped me with my lunch selections and we exchanged a small pile of cash for a page-o-matic, a few minutes later food calls and then I'm heading back to the lab with a sac-o'-goodies: Dan Dan Noodles plus Pork n Chive dumplings we're oh so good and lived up to the hype: pop the top and jam a fork under the noodles, stir it roundy round and let the flavors mingle while sharing some dumpley goodness. Yea chili sauce!! Soft but firm noodles are so good and so full-feeling; shredded meats, nuts, and green bits hanging out in hot sauce making the most of our time together. ...if I had a rice maker for at work this would be perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dumpling Lady - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dan Dan Noodles and Pork y Chives
Photo of The Dumpling Lady - Charlotte, NC, United States. sack lunch...

MlUrWCgyYtvCZDU54nM4zQ.text: The best. Simply the best food ever. Plenty of options and more to come in her food stall! Vegan, vegetarian options are amazing as well. Be prepared for a line, but well worth it. Don't come here if you can't handle your spice, leave it for the rest of us!

emenXqIZVyWVIhkLmEYcAQ.text: I was meeting a couple of friends at a nearby brewery and this was the food truck they had here. I wanted the sweet pork dumplings, but unfortunately they did not have any left (but failed to erase it off the board...).  I went with the pork and chive instead.  The flavor was very good, but there was a little kick to it that I was not expecting. They are smaller dumplings than other places as well. I think they come with 10 dumplings, which was a decent size - although I could have eaten a few more or even split another with a friend. Overall, I enjoyed the meal and I look forward to being able to try the sweet pork dumplings next time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dumpling Lady - Charlotte, NC, United States

tt9eCxIiP_tS_XPrCFGbTA.text: I swear, I will find a way to convince Yelp to add a 6th star if the Dumpling Lady starts bottling and selling that magical sauce! Seriously, y'all. It is so good. The last time we had dumplings, we went to Yummi and bought a banh mi just to soak up the extra sauce. The time before that, we put the lid back on the tin and brought the extra sauce home with us. It's an actual crime to just throw away the sauce you can't manage to sop up with dumplings.   Oh, yeah. The dumplings are to die for, too. ;) Super flavorful and always stuffed with tasty, fresh fillings like chicken and mushrooms, pork and chives, etc. And, don't even get me started on the buns. A great option to soak up the extra sauce as well, btw.   If you're lucky enough to be at the same place at the same time as the Dumpling Lady, pay her a visit!

6UeZm_v8W9yh76Gyt5GfJA.text: Dumpling lady, I love your food. Spicy noodles, perfect dumplings... you know how to rock some flavor & keep me coming back for more!

xBFWsqaL4DmB8QunOSB3Wg.text: Spicy as hell . Those noodles have authentic peppers in them so be prepared. I believe every entree is made with them. I had the veggie dumplings and they were good. From what I was told they are the most popular selling ones.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dumpling Lady - Charlotte, NC, United States

C_65p9C8LD5_X1oKLtvwNg.text: Really enjoyed my first taste of my new favorite food. Any dumpling you pick is gonna be delicious.

QmcdJPSDoCKqMEA421BcIQ.text: The people running the truck are nice. I remarked how I'd been wanting to try the dumplings for over a year, and he asked how I'd heard about them.  Word of mouth and Yelp, of course.  I told him I'd been looking for a good dumpling ever since I left DC.   Which isn't entirely accurate. There dumpling place wasn't in DC. It was in Rockville, MD. And I would make my way out of the district to the outskirts of the capital beltway for the wondrous dumplings and amazing chili sauce they served.  What caught my eye about this particular purveyor of dumplings is that The Dumpling Lady serves the dumplings in tins of chili sauce.  I adore chili sauce. I wouldn't say I am obsessed with eating spicy food. I don't purposely go out searching out food made from Carolina Reaper Pepper. I do enjoy spicy foods, however.   The gentleman who took my order had asked if I liked spicier foods, I said yes, he said that he would have them make it spicier, which I appreciated.  I ordered two orders of dumplings. Pork & Chives and Chicken & Shrimp.  I ate the Chicken & Shrimp first. I was dumbfounded. This sauce is great if you don't like spicy foods. The flavor of the sauce falls a bit on the bland side for me. I ate the dumplings without a drink nearby. It was unnecessary. I wondered if I was doing something wrong.  I tried the Pork & Chives.   Oh.   Here was the spice. Only one order of dumplings was 'spicy.' For reference, the hotter version of their chili sauce is less spicy than the Sweet Heat dipping sauce that you can get at Popeyes that accompanies chicken tenders. The heat might be more comparable to Texas Pete or Frank's Red Hot Sauce. I was mildly disappointed. I still did not need a drink.  I did not enjoy the flavor of the Pork & Chives dumplings, either. They used a certain spice in their ground pork mix. It reminded me vaguely of licorice. I am not a fan of licorice. This spice was not present in the Chicken & Shrimp dumpling. Maybe it's supposed to taste like that. And people enjoy that flavor profile. I do not. That's okay. Variety is the spice of life and such.  The texture of the dumpling was adequate, though the dumplings were a bit on the small side.   All in all, a very average dumpling experience.  I'll probably go back if I get a fierce craving for dumplings and the stars align that it happens to be on a Saturday (where they are at NoDa Company Store from 11:30AM - 8:00PM regularly, as of the time of this review.)   I was left wanting.  More spice. Larger dumplings. Less licorice flavor (Star anise? Fennel, maybe?)

_EoyHDMI7A4zqctpWGSZ9g.text: I love the pork and chive dumplings!! I recommend them to EVERYONE!!! I've had a couple of her other items as well, but this is definitely a favorite of mine. I prefer to find her free standing and not at a food truck event though.

hMSvypilPBJW_mhWzoubyA.text: I was worried about the spice since everyone talked about it in reviews but it wasnt overwhelming and the flavors were fantastic. I tried the pork belly, and one of a coworkers veggie - both were delicious and oozing with flavor. I can't wait to try the other flavors!

rxKv9o5McCwlaIefYHt6Ng.text: One taste of the delicious dumplings and I had to have my own! I stalked the food truck on IG until a location was in my path. It was raining slightly but I was not to be deterred. I ordered (dumplings, of course) and received one of those things you hold on to so they can buzz you when the food is ready). I was told about 10 minutes. I went inside the establishment to use the restroom. While washing my hands, I hear this noise that sounds like someone's cell phone. It wasn't mine so I am looking at the other patron. She is looking at me. I feel a buzzing on my person. I am searching and searching, wondering what the loud noise could be (almost like an emergency alert). Finally, I find it and realize, oh, that's my food; it's ready! That was an experience. In any case, the dumplings were delicious. They were $10 and you get five big ones if I recall correctly. It was plenty for my stomach and I can't wait to get more! BTW, service was great with friendly conversation; they patiently helped me decide on my selection.

ky7j2M1KK8O6KG43fLlKGg.text: If you haven't had a chance to try these dumplings, please do yourself a favor and join me  as I follow them all over the qc to get my fix.  They have many flavors of dumplings(chicken, shrimp, veggie, etc.)  but the sweet pork belly dumplings are exceptional!  Tender flavorful dumplings with a spicy chili sauce.  They are melt in your mouth good!  They also offer a few noodle dishes as well and they are equally great, but my fav will forever be the sweet pork belly!  Don't take my word for it, check them out!

i6OXMoL1byvLRZNEK8-9Kw.text: Her Dumplings are the best in the WORLD.  I literally can't stop eating when I start...its a problem.  You can't go wrong with anything on the menu...although I can't move past the dumplings!  And that sauce!!!!!!!!

iYWw-Hh_8KVgmCqyLVCbRw.text: I LOVE their noodles, any flavor is good and authentic. I usually like dumplings with meat stuffing but here I like their veggie dumplings. Still can tell they alter a bit in their sauce to cater to American's taste (Not enough Sichuan pepper and chili pepper, but that will really scare a lot American away, ha!) look forward to their new restaurant and expanded menu, will definitely support them!

giHw3xuwS5rrSUflvWi33Q.text: Dumpling Lady, I love you.  These dumplings are legit. Qian learned all the recipes and tricks from her grandmother. Every dumpling is made by hand. Seriously, right now they're making around 2,000 a day.   She gets all her proteins from local farms. Dumpling wise, I really don't think you can go wrong with any of them. They are all delicious. The sauce is stupid good. During week day lunches, they usually have a noodle and dumpling combo option. Even when there's not a combo option on the weekends, I'll still order both dumplings and noodles. Hey, sometimes you need two lunches (who am I kidding, I always end up eating all of it the minute I get home).  The best way to find them is on their Instagram or Facebook. They post the schedule each week. The Dumpling Lady is also available to cater private events, parties, and corporate lunches.

I can't pretend to identify all the flavors going on, but it's a deliciously spicy oil that's both fresh and cooling and a continually building slow burn all at once. Absolutely delicious and constantly at top performance. Get the chicken and mushroom with the pork belly and you will not be disappointed.

1cnKivhJsbi6CUDIOubivQ.text: I got to taste this deliciousness yesterday at NoDa Co Store and I am in love. These are hands down the best dumplings in town. I tried the chicken and mushroom and vegetarian ones and they were so yum i couldn't stop eating to take.pictures. You can follow the dumpling lady on instagram to see where the truck is going to be. Highly recommend all to try this tasty food.

1sSoeGATOSXOFogQ7KbfrA.text: This is hands down one of the best food trucks in Charlotte!  The noodles are deliciously spicy and the dumplings are equally tasty.  Whenever her truck is by my office, we all go for lunch!  Good lunch combo deal (one noodle dish and 6 dumplings).

tidofAyeCAhWQ_W091loKA.text: Don't know what all the hoopla is all about.  It's fine, but it's nothing to drive out of the way for.

bW6ENsTwAMcAixtjI73kJw.text: Hey! I finally saw and caught the unicorn!  I tried to time my visit st the company store where I can catch the farmers market and the dumpling lady at the same.damn.time. But, I missed the farmers market. But this food right here....cue Oprah...DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!!  I got the spicy beef noodles and chicken and shrimp dumplings. Everything people have said is True. I loved it all. I didn't share and I split it for 2 different lunches.   Can't wait to go back. Bravo!

YUi2g3p9BfUN1TE8iYq7cw.text: My husband and I love food trucks! We heard about The Dumpling Lady when we first moved to Charlotte and put it at the top of our list to try.   The best way to find the Dumpling Lady is to follow her on social media (Facebook and Instagram). Every week they constantly update their locations so you know where they'll be Monday through Saturday.   We decided to give it a try on a Saturday when I got out of work. They we posted up at Noda Company Store which is also a fantastic spot for drinks. Naturally, we tried the dumplings. I tried the Vegetable and he tried the Chicken and Mushroom.  I didn't realize that the dumplings were served with a spicy sauce. I went back to inform them I couldn't eat the dumplings because I can't eat anything spicy. She felt terrible! Made me new ones with out the sauce, didn't charge me and let me keep the original dumplings (which my husband ended up eating.)   First and foremost, let's talk about the stellar customer service. She took the blame and made things right, even when I offered to pay for the new food. The service is very efficient...unless that place is packed, expect a slight delay. Most people are understanding since these dumplings are made to order, it's a two person operation and they are in a food truck.   The food....oh my gosh y'all these dumplings are incredible!!! They are fresh, light and so so so tasty! They don't just have dumplings either. A different visit, my husband had a noodle dish that he won't stop talking about. If you like spicy food, this is right up your alley!

QCCSyIVaOzHhcb1KC9RmIQ.text: Overhyped! We started following The Dumpling Lady on Instagram and trekked to Camp North End recently when we saw they were serving lunch there. We tried six dishes from The Dumpling Lady and the dumpling dishes were good (just good, not exceptional) but the noodle dishes were very underwhelming - the beef noodle dish was basically noodles and heavily spiced ground beef.  Also, the dishes are very hot  (spicy hot) so be warned if you're sensitive or if you're buying for kids.

l-ToIz4swVxqr7ZF48ZWbg.text: I been looking forward to try the dumpling lady for a year now. I am from out of states on vacation. This was my second lunch choice to have in Charlotte, NC. I was not impressed at all. Our order consists of pork and chive dumplings, chicken and mushroom, and spicy noodles. The dumplings has no flavor at all the skin was to mushy in my opinion. Both dumplings just tasted pretty much similar. I prefer the the chewy texture of a dumpling. The sauce on both dumpling has no wow factor it was chili sauce and very oily. I wish dumpling lady had also a sauce option like an ginger base soy sauce. Both dumplings were drenched in her chili oil sauce.  For the noodles wow I never had this happen to me be before my tongue went numb after chewing on a herb leaf. I could not identify what kind of herb it was it was a tad minty. The noodles itself also lacks good flavor it was just drenched in the same sauce as the dumplings with the licorice minty flavor from the herb that made my tongue go numb. I was scared to finish the noodles or dumplings after my tongue going numb. At that point I avoided any of that green herb both in my noodles and dumplings. We hardly finished the dumplings or meat in the sauce. Everything was luke warm nothing was piping hot. There is a limited vegetarian options. Service was good the man was very attentive and kept composure it was pretty busy.

They have a very mild to medium heat which is a perfect match for the flavor of the dumplings. Next to try are the noodles!

nBDl0yv1cYWAmMXn41nh8Q.text: I've had a loving relationship now with The Dumpling Lady, and have spent many weeks trying to duck out of class or work early, or even changing my schedule to go out of my way to stop and try the whole selection of dumplings. Now that I finally have, I would love to give the truck five stars.  The dumplings are wonderful, each with a unique flavor profile, which made it exciting to order each time. My favorite, and a must-have is the Sweet Pork Belly dumplings. It is my understanding that these are also the most popular, which doesn't surprise me at all.   I've always been treated well by the staff, and they have been super helpful, especially for decision making in my earliest experiences. The only thing keeping me from giving The Dumpling Lady five stars is accessibility. On more than a couple of occasions I have attempted to get dumplings in the last 45 minutes of posted service and arrived to a closed truck, or no truck.   Really though, this is easily one of the best dumplings you can find in Charlotte.

YExx5oqRLv-w1PUEo2ccIg.text: I have been wanting to try the Dumpling Lady for a while now and happened to catch them by coincidence at an event at Abari. So glad I decided to grab something!!  We ordered the spicy beef noodles and the pork and chive dumplings. Both were fantastic! The dumplings were made perfectly and so flavorful. That sauce. The spicy noodles were definitely spicy but it was that, make you wanna come back for more, kind of spice.   I really appreciate them giving us a pager to know when our food is ready, opposed to having to listen for your name.  I can't wait to try other options!

IyjvfxG_OKZ-gaIrca4N6Q.text: I ordered the Burning Noodles, and they said it was really spicy, however I have a big tolerance so it wasn't spicy for me at all. However it was delicious. Also my friends ordered the pork and chives dumpling, and they said it was AM-AZ-ING!!! I wasn't able to order the veggie dumplings cause they ran out.  Definitely need to go back for veggie dumplings.

FUbHGxWtJgKJBV4ZArujsw.text: Read about the dumpling lady long before I moved to Charlotte. Finally made the trip up to South End to find her parked outside a beer garden. Ordered three different types: pork belly, shrimp/chicken and crab/chicken. I'm not particularly fond of super hot spicy food so I told her to keep the spices mild. Ho Lee Sheet ! Even the mild dumplings tore me a new one! Had to drink a quart of milk just to neutralize the flaming cauldron inside my stomach. Lovely lady and all but Jeezus!

ahUvKqI8gjzd7m24MrQ_yQ.text: Unfortunately I was disappointed in the hype of the Dumpling Lady - I was excited to come and try this after reading articles about this new food truck. We ordered the pork & chives dumplings, the pork belly  zha jiang noodles, the pork belly steamed bun, and the chicken & mushroom dumplings. While none of the food tasted bad, it wasn't the best either. The dumpling skin was the right thickness but the actual flavors were a bit bland compared to your traditional homemade dumplings - the sauce helped a lot. The pork belly bun was a bit misleading as it's not the typical pork belly you'd think of - more like minced pork bun, not the fatty slice that people are used to. The zha jiang noodles were probably my favorite of the night - just the right heat and flavor. One of our friends ordered the spicy beef noodles and beware of the Szechuan spice! It can kill your tastebuds if you're not used to it!

2EJ-RJa_aCQKxo6ZEQZdnQ.text: Finally got to try this local favorite mobile this Friday @ Camp North End. Yep. It's gooood!!  Got the Spicy Beef Noddles & Sweet Pork Belly Dumplings. The reviews about the AMAZING sauce are True. You will find some way to save/use it. Also spicy, but you can't stop eating them. That's why people complain that there are "only" ten dumplings. Any other place, ten would be plenty. Not these. You end up just devouring them!!  And people early to event confirmed that everything is fresh & handmade. They watched them make everything. Wow! The only reason for the 4 stars is because I agree with my fellow Yelpers that SOMETHING should be provided with the dinner service. At lunch she serves rice with your meal. Yo_p6yzdl4dM1vzi-fHDag.text: We had heard a good bit about The Dumpling Lady. To be fair, we are not exactly fans of the food truck scene overall, but we are fans of Asian food in general, and dumplings specifically, and had an afternoon to spare, so thought we would give it a go. The first thing, as with many food trucks, is figuring out where they are on any given day. With The Dumpling Lady, I searched on Google and found their web page. Right there on the home page, I found a schedule. It mentions their normal schedule for each day. Unfortunately it does not include Sunday, and we were out on a Sunday. However, there is a mention of both Instagram and a locations tab. Since I was already on the web site, I checked the locations tab. No luck there, still no Sunday. But it does mention Facebook as well as Instagram. I checked Facebook quickly, and it looked like most of those were actually coming from Instagram, so off I went. There I found the standard pictures of food, as well as a number of scheduley-looking posts (looking sort of like a menu). Seeming like a good place to start, I pulled up the most recent one at the time. This is important. On that day, it was this one: instagram.com/p/BjBGvytH... You can also see a copy here: ibb.co/crj1Ky And I have uploaded a copy to the business photos here on Yelp, and to the last two I have added an arrow to show the time at Triple C. Why be so detailed? Simply to point out - mostly to myself, perhaps - that I'm not completely insane. Next up: The waiting (perhaps abnormal). After running some errands in the morning, we arrive at Triple C at a bit after 2pm. At the time, the truck was there, with a single person in the back, however it was not open for orders. After checking to verify that they are not open yet, and being told it will be "about fifteen minutes" - which would be around 2:30 - we head inside and get a drink and proceed to wait. Since it's a nice day - not yet that hot - we sit and observe. We notice that there is indeed a single individual inside, working to (do stuff). There are a bunch of folks, and a few dogs, hanging out enjoying the day. While we are not what you would call regulars, it does seem that more than a few of them are waiting on the food, since only a small percentage are actually drinking - and many are watching the truck. It is during this time that we find out at least one couple has been there since 12:30 (only because they mention it both now and after placing their order at the window a short while later). Another person nods their agreement that they have been waiting a while, but does not seem to have been there as long. Sometime between our arrival and 2:30ish, another person arrives and begins helping in the truck. Not sure if this person was there before and returned (maybe went to get things and came back) or only now arrived for the first time. At least it seems that we're getting closer. Around the promised time - in person, not online - the window opens. But orders take a few minutes more because the menus have to be written on the chalkboards. And now: The ordering (probably fairly standard, except a small issue). Eventually, we get to the point where we can order. There are menus on the chalkboards. There are printed menus that you can read when you get to the front that explain items in detail. The staff can explain in even more detail if needed. This actually goes fairly well, and the line moves quickly. This is where we hear (again) that one couple has been there for a couple of hours. Not sure why, unless they just really, really, like dumplings, but that's their choice. I don't wait a couple of hours for much of anything. Regardless, after ordering, you pay on a Square-type of terminal, and normally would get a pager-type device to notify you when your order is ready. This is similar to if you're in a restaurant waiting for your table to be ready. Only this isn't working. So they take your name instead. The verdict? If it was all about the pork dumplings, you'd be looking at four stars all day long. Perhaps something strange like a 3.8, but I'd round up without batting an eye. Unfortunately the chicken dumplings and the beef noodles add little, and in fact likely take away from the experience. Enough to drop all the way to a three star? Maybe, maybe not. Throw in the waiting and the issues with the scheduling and it's a different story. On a side note, I did mention originally about getting up at the "crack of noon". Perhaps that rubbed them the wrong way. I make that comment - and I am sure, others - off the top of my head a lot and maybe it rubs a lot of folks the wrong way. If it did, I apologize. One more note. Qian sent me a message to say this was the first week they changed their schedule from 12:30 to 2:00pm. Unfortunately they forgot to post this anywhere. The apology is certainly welcome. But if you depend on an online source to get an update, and there is no update? That sorta stinks.

aDn3zZJ5VHW_BT3qb4APRQ.text: Best food truck in Charlotte! I waited 45 minutes in line just to see get my dumplings and it was worth every second. The dumplings literally melt in your mouth. I got the sweet pork belly, and it was so delicious. The sauce that they are covered with is the final touch. For the most bang for your buck, it's about $13 for the noodle and dumpling combo and is soooo filling. I make it a habit to visit on Fridays for lunch uptown.

Aajjlu_6cU98l_6bU_7_bA.text: Heard a lot of good things about this Food Truck and finally ran into it one day Uptown while I was hungry #Win. There was a little line at the window but it moved fast. She was very friendly and offered suggestions of some of her favs. The food came out pretty fast too. I ordered the chicken and shrimp dumplings as well as the spicy beef noodles. The dumplings were definitely some of the best I have had just make sure you don't have on a nice shirt because you will have red oily spots all over you (or was that just me being hungry). The spicy beef noodles were really good but definitely spicy and I love spicy.  I would absolutely recommend this truck if you were see it around town. Can't wait to try all of the other menu items especially the other dumplings.

1wzCdyMPGENXXEoYz0-SyQ.text: The dumpling lady consistently delivers! Honestly, I cannot remember having had better dumplings in the past few years.  I used to be all about the shrimp & chicken but I have found a new favorite in the chicken & mushroom. They are something that I can find myself eating for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  What sends them over the top is the homemade chili oil that coats them. I have even seen people drink that sauce directly from the pan!  The normal menu consists of multiple flavors of dumplings and noodles. For the lunch combo, you can combine one flavor of dumpling and one type of noodle for $12. Normally, one portion of dumplings go for $9. Just note the lunch combo portion of dumplings is reduced to six from the usual nine, however, the noodle portion remains the same.  Thanks to the ever-growing popularity of the dumpling lady, I see the truck popping up at more and more places. Most consistently, the truck can be found at Noda Company Store....and, thankfully, at my business park every other week! The most surprising fact I read about the actual Dumpling Lady is that she recently moved from China to Charlotte a little over three years ago.  The truck has Instagram, facebook, and twitter pages so you can keep up with the schedule and menu. Once you find this truck, you'll soon learn why there are so many fans!

Now when it says "spicy" be cautious that Asian and Indian spice levels are not to be compared to American levels of spicy. This is one of my favorite lunch options at one Wells Fargo center. Make time in your schedule to stop by.

dE3apS_4G2hasW0mhUBtXA.text: I have heard so many good things about the Dumpling Lady and finally bumped into her one night after dinner.  I have been searching and finally found her, so I had to grab some to go.     Let me apologize in advance on the picture that I attached as this was the following day.  As I said earlier, we had just finished a big dinner right before we stumbled upon her so I didn't get to enjoy till the next day. Qdx6MawcL8G9Oz9f5U_Lzw.text: Rain, shine, snow on the ground. Didn't matter..on Friday if this truck was parked outside Wells Fargo One during lunch hours it's #dumplingfriday! These dumplings are completely amazing. The flavor is REAL, it's authentic, bright with cilantro, zesty, fresh from bits of spring onion, spicy with chile oil but light and delicate enough to perfectly coat each precious dumpling. The dumplings are served in orders of 10. Which is filling for lunch, sometimes I've order a small white rice from a nearby Chinese restaurant to sop up the extra sauce and balance out the spicy.  I've tried the veggie, shrimp & chicken, chicken & mushroom and sweet pork belly. All but the sweet pork belly have a thicker, more constructed rice dumpling wrapper. The pork belly has a softer, yellow, thin dumpling wrapper -that plus the fattier pork belly's ability to soak up the sauce flavor better makes the sweet pork belly dumplings my fav. and go to! The lines for lunch are usually long but it's always worth it. The cashiers have restaurant style buzzers to let you know when your food is ready, they also have umbrellas available to use while you wait if it's raining .  The dumpling lady deserves all the awards, the store front and cult following she gets! Also try the berrynade it's house-made fruity lemonade with fresh assorted minced fruit in it,  it goes well with all the dumpling spiciest!

hv7GDKX7LsLctZhIN_4dWQ.text: I've been excited to try the Dumpling Lady for a while and was totally let down today. We had the chicken/mushroom and the chicken/shrimp dumplings as well as the chili chicken noodles. The dumplings were good but the wrapper was thick and the sauce too oily. The shrimp in the dumpling did not taste fresh. For better tasting dumplings, try the Dim Sum restaurant for weekend lunch. As for the noodles, what can I say...I've had chili chicken noodles in China several times and they are super spicy but have a layered, flavorful heat. The Dumpling Lady's version is smack in your face, palate deadening heat. It had dried cayenne peppers as well as jalapenos, something never used together in this dish in Asia. Save your taste buds and skip the chili chicken noodles. Next time I'll order something from the Taco Truck instead.

25X4-88repvwJnmxwH1a8A.text: I finally caught up with the dumpling lady...and it was totally worth it!   I ordered he spicy beef noodles and the shrimp and chicken dumplings.   The spicy beef noodles were awesome! They were definitely spicy. And the flavors in this dish were everything and more. The chicken and shrimp dumplings were very tasty too. I am looking forward to trying the other options too...because they all sound so delicious.   If you're lucky enough to catch this truck...I absolutely recommend giving them a try!

7QnTRjh0AJY4OEOVWSpbsA.text: I love dumplings and it's hard to find great dumplings.These really are some of the best dumplings in town, but the sauce is what brings it to the next level. However, if you don't like spicy food, you may want to ask for them without sauce. It's a chili oil with hints of ginger and scallions. I ordered the pork and chive, but honestly this flavor blends in with the sauce. The dumplings aren't too doughy and have a good bit of meat.   There's a lunch combo which combines your choice of noodles and six dumplings for $12. For my noodle selection, I tried the spicy beef because I love spicy food. I've had the burning noodles here before, but to me the spicy beef had more heat. The noodles themselves have a great texture. Again the sauce is great and very similar to the dumpling sauce, but very spicy. I took in a couple of peppercorns which had my mouth on fire. I like the freshness of the carrots and cucumber, but it was missing the papaya that was listed on the menu description.  The flavors overall played well together.   My only critique is the time it takes to get food. I caught them at Well's Fargo uptown during peak lunchtime at noon. I waited about 25 minutes to order and then another 10 minutes for food. I like that they had pagers so you don't have to wait for your name to be shouted.  It was a nice day and I like that this location has plenty of tables on the plaza. I barely had time to eat on my hour lunch break since it's about a ten minute walk back to my office.   You're not going to find food this authentic in any area take out restaurant.

RkpOaD-_uPTq2OLqOxqY1Q.text: Really good spot in Optimist Hall! We ordered the Pork & Chives dumplings and some noodles. The dumplings had great flavor and texture. V-MBqNBikriRFH0HVtHq-g.text: Delicious Asian cuisine with the convenience of a food truck? Yes please!  My good friend Chris, along with most of the Charlotte Yelp community rants and raves about this little truck and after having finally sampled their fare myself I can see why. They were part of a food truck rally at Resident Culture last week and while there were certainly people waiting for every truck The Dumpling Lady had the distinction of longest line.   Their menu has a few noodle dishes as well, but the obvious draw is the dumplings. They had 5 varieties to choose from when I visited: Pork and Chives, Chicken and Mushrooms, Shrimp and Chicken, Sweet Pork Belly, and Veggie. With a price of $10 for 10 dumplings you'd be hard pressed to find a better bang for your buck, especially of this quality. You can even buy a dozen dumplings pre-frozen right from the truck (for a similar price) and take them home for later!   I ordered the Pork and Chives myself, but I also managed to try one of the Pork Belly my friend had. The Pork and Chive dumplings were delicious. It's the kind of dish where you could easily eat two dozen before realizing what you did. Relatively small but packed with flavor they come served in a round tin foil container with an excellent spicy dipping sauce soaking the bottom. I've had a lot of dumplings over the years, so I don't know I can definitively say these are the best I've ever had, but they are very good. That sauce on the other hand is absolutely the best dumplings accompaniment I've ever tasted. The Pork Belly was somehow richer and lighter at the same time, not giving off the same slow heat of the Pork and Chives. I think the fact that it didn't come drenched in the spicy sauce is what made it stand out as different, but both were excellent. Lets be honest, it's hard to be unhappy with well seasoned pork, whatever form its in.   A favorite to be sure. I'll keep my eyes open for that little red truck at any future food trucks rallies I visit.

TxGFlMSTyQF0v6AXEsaAoA.text: Ordered the shrimp & chicken dumplings and they were great, lots of flavor! I think 9 or so dumplings cake with the order which was plenty as a side. Can't wait to go back to try another dish.

60gsz5GEI-Kv41XcWIyawQ.text: I wish I could properly put into words how much I'm obsessed with these dumplings. I check the dumpling lady's schedule every week because if I go longer that 7 days without those delicious spicy morsels of joy, I start going through withdrawals.   The sweet pork belly is usually the most popular item, but is limited so it goes quick. My go-to is the pork and chives dumplings, with an order of the beef noodle dish. It's too much food for me, but the noodles keep surprisingly well in the fridge. The spice level is perfectly hot. Enough that it keeps you coming back for more even though your nose is running.   I haven't had the opportunity to try everything on the menu yet, but trust me I will. Pro-tip: She also sells her dumplings frozen too, (with a side of that delicious sauce of course). I have a bamboo steamer at home and if I'm in a pinch it satisfies my craving.   Their locations change on a weekly basis, so check their Instagram for their weekly schedule but two of my favorite places to catch up with the dumpling lady is at the NoDa Company Store on the weekends, or at Resident Culture on a Friday Night.

EpfNliXpAkzEPZqc9CctgA.text: This updated review is for the new permanent location in Optimist Hall. I had the lunch special with burning noodles and Chengdu dumplings. The noodles had a strong and complex combination of flavors, and were nicely cooling on a hot day. The dumplings kind of fell apart in my chopsticks, but were also delicious, especially the sauce. I believe that both dishes had the mala (hot and numbing) flavor that's unique to Sichuan cuisine.   I'm already looking forward to when I can come back here for another lunch. R_kOYOyY-vGxnhyFyffAFA.text: Oh my where do I begin... basically we pick what we are going to do on weekends based on where the Dumpling Lady will be that day. irCXXiJBobxG0yODDtGpuQ.text: Our whole experience here was a letdown. I've been hearing for awhile now, how great the Dumpling Lady's food is, and I was excited to finally give it a try.   - 15+ minute wait to place our order.  - My mother in law can't handle spicy food, so we asked if it was possible to get one of the noodle dishes less spicy, and the guy working the register got an attitude with my wife for even asking, to the point that she had to walk away to avoid losing it in front of the kids - $27 for two small dumpling selections and two drinks - Half of my steamed dumplings were cold like they'd just been pulled out of the refrigerator - All the dumplings touching the bottom of the dishes were stuck to it, making it impossible to eat without tearing them apart.   The flavor was decent, but the experience definitely did not live up to the hype this place gets. Not even close to the best dumplings I've had in Charlotte, and the long wait and rude service just amplified the disappointment.

bYnosqtv-p5SbLpFYFGofA.text: Friends,  We are in the midst of a new era of Dumplings. How could Charlotte's BEST food truck (by Charlotte Magazine and many others) get any better? How about open in the hottest new venue in Charlotte and offer so much more in their new stall! I'm a long time customer of the truck and was thrilled to be able to try two new items today.  I arrived at Optimist Hall around 1:30 today and the parking lot was packed. The food hall is still considered being under its "soft opening" stage so bear with the construction and many of the stalls not open yet. It is nice to have what I would consider my favorites already up and open. In my opinion, The Dumpling Lady's stall stands out over the rest with warm red and gold accents around the exterior and modern wood paneling along the corners and counter. I love their stall's sign above the register that's simple yet bold. Being day two of operations, everything was of course squeaky clean.  So the two new items I tried today was the Chengdu Style Pork & Scallion Boiled Dumpling, and the Garlic Pork Belly Side. The Pork and scallion was one of the best dumplings I've ever had. The pork filling was so savory, tender, and moist, and the dumpling had an amazing supple texture that was perfect. I love how boiled dumplings 'soak up' the sauce and the sauce complimented the dumpling very well. Slightly spicy, sweet, salty, the garlic based chili oil is something I wish they'd bottle and sell, but to be honest it would take away some of the magic of visiting this place if I could have it at home!  Garlic Pork Belly was delicious and tender. Instead of crisping the pork, they serve it layered with thinly sliced cucumber for the slight crunch and top it with the garlic sauce that I love. At $6 it's a bit pricey but the flavor profile is worth it.  They're going to kill it here, everything I love about one of my favorite trucks in a brick-and-mortar. Quality ingredients, amazing flavors, and more to come! This will be one of my most visited spots, I can already tell.  Congrats on the opening, Qian and team, I'll see you soon!

oaYStv-5hjS7SV6XICrYLA.text: I'll admit it; I am a complete sucker for food trucks and anything that gets labeled as "street food."  Whether domestically or abroad, I'm automatically enticed by that wafting aroma coming from a curbside cart or a lingering truck.  Whether Halal, dumplings, hot dogs, no matter what's being served, I'll probably eat it if it comes from a street food cart or truck.  With that said, I'd wanted to try The Dumpling Lady for some time, but never really had the opportunity as it's always somewhere different and I can be exceptionally lazy.  However, on one especially motivated Saturday afternoon, we made the trip to Noda Company Store to finally check it out.  Upon walking up to the counter, my first impression was how overwhelmingly nice the woman working at the truck was.  Seriously, she was great and really helpful to the customers in front of us who didn't know really what they wanted.  We had a pretty good idea from looking at the menu online, and went for the following:  LUNCH Combo: Spicy Beef Noodles w/Sweet Pork Belly Dumplings -Order of Pork & Chives Dumplings  It's worth noting that The Dumpling Lady offers soft drinks at the truck, but as it was parked at Noda Company Store, we had to go for a draft Hop Drop & Roll (they also have free ice water in pitchers, which is nice when it's 90+ degrees outside.  The sweet pork belly dumplings are absolutely delicious, and we should've done 10 of these and 6 of the Pork & Chives.  Very sweet, savory in the chili-sauce and absolutely delicious.  The pork & chives are similarly delicious, but lacking that sweetness and extra flavor profile that puts the sweet pork belly over the top.  The Spicy Beef noodles are very good in the spicy-chili sauce, and pair well with the dumplings, but are nonetheless secondary to how good the dumplings are (which is probably how it should be, given the name).  Overall, we had a very good lunch and really enjoyed our time here.  Definitely on my Charlotte recommended list and somewhere to check out when you can track them down (they post the schedule on Instagram!)

VJnA4WA_wBV9bQA-3c22-A.text: This place has amazing dumplings, handcrafted by the dumpling artist in the back. The savory dumplings are complemented by their wide range of delicious noodles as well. If you have been used to their food truck, you will get the same smiling service and delicious food they have been serving for years. The charm of optimist hall helps to give you a good ole sit-down vibe which is a great addition to the delicious food as well.  Pros  - Great parking  - Staff is friendly - The charm of the food truck is kept in this new location - New menu items not on the food truck have been added, like the Soup Dumplings.    Cons A long line, so get ready to stand  Pro-Tip Go during lunch for their infamous lunch special, you will get a half order of dumplings as well as noodles. This is a great combo and you'll get the bang for your buck

GazRDQT2YAvh0SVelVedbg.text: You might look at this and see "just dumplings", but oh man, is it anything except just dumplings. This is another classic example of taking a common food you can get anywhere and really paying attention to each detail so that you're left with the best expression of what the food can be. The dumplings are stupid good. The dough is perfect, the pork was perfect, the sauce was perfect. Honestly the only thing that wasn't perfect was how much food you get for the price. We had the Sweet Pork Belly Dumplings, and you get 8 for $10. We ended up going home to make a second dinner since we were still hungry, but if you treat these like an "every once in a while" luxury, the dumplings are so good you can justify it. This new location is nestled into the newly renovated Optimist Hall, so the atmosphere is amazing as well. I don't have to track down the truck to get my dumpling fix? I'm down.

Z3NvRnHeKhDg1or9bsIrtA.text: For lunch, I stopped by this popular food truck at South Park area to try on their super-delish Dumplings and Noodles.  Thank God I got there super-early 'cuz within minutes, the long line quickly began forming...to the point that it made the other food trucks look sad.  Anyway, I was one of the first in line; and I ordered the much-anticipated Sweet Pork Belly Dumplings and the Spicy Beef Noodles Combo (Lunch Special)...and as expected, DOUBLE YUM!! Both were good, but the Sweet Pork Belly is BEYOND Good...maybe even BEYOND Great. It's in the league of OMG's!! One thing that CAN be improved is the slicing of the Cucumbers in the Spicy Beef Noodles...cut way too big, making them hard to eat with the noodles. I debated cutting a star for it, but given how delicious it was, I'll let it pass.  I also wish there were more tables...and maybe some chairs? This is probably not the Lady's fault. Guess I'm expecting too much from a food truck venue.  Really, I can't ask for more from a food truck. Judging by the lunch-hour fandom (at a business building parking lot!), this has got to be one of the best food trucks around. I definitely plan on hunting down this Sweet 'n Spicy Lady again...hopefully real soon!

rnv8z0hMfI1Rq7p3p6PfRQ.text: Eight weeks on the road without some real Chinese food makes Kai kind of desperate. Desperate Kai eats gas station dumplings in South Carolina and gas station dumplings are not a good thing.   So I get back to CLT and I'm craving ramen and wait... What. Is. This?? Sichuan beef noodles? I'm out the door and headed for NoDa. Unfortunately, that's not where the Dumpling Lady is and she's nowhere to be found. So, despondent and in dismay, I head towards some izakaya place for some (hopefully) decent ramen. And somehow, by some stroke of luck, I drive by Birdsong Tap House and there in the parking lot is a red trailer... Where the Dumpling Lady lives.   The Dumpling Lady hails from Szechwan, home of the giant panda and some of the burningest, most ass firing, toilet humbling food on earth. The Dumpling Lady and her husband don't dumb their food down and definitely do not water it down. A variety of noodle and dumpling dishes grace the menu, stuff the likes of Charlotte has never seen. I got an order of beef noodles swimming in chili oil, with marinated bamboo and tender chunks of beef, as well as an order of pork and leek dumplings doused with a spicy soy and scallions. Both were phenomenal, better than most I've had even back in Los Angeles. Spicy, yes, but that's what Birdsong is for. Get yourself an IPA and douse that burning sissy boy.   In all seriousness, this is a great sign for things to Come in CLT. Talking to the Dumpling Lady and Mr. Dumpling Lady, they've got great plans for Charlotte, and judging by the responses of the other patrons, they'll be hotly welcomed by the locals. Apparently, the NoDa address is their home base, but the trailer travels. This was their first night at Birdsong, but expect to find them at Atherton as well as NoDa.   Best of luck to you Mr and Mrs Dumpling Lady!  Oh. One tip. If you're allergic to cabbage, don't eat the kimchee.

bXCxhb_nE2cnkWC4zk6QcA.text: I was very excited to maybe find a good dumpling place...  While ordering i asked about something they refer to as their ultimate spicy sauce. They didnt have any that day but they said that they had regular spicy sauce but i was only given regular dumpling sauce.   The order taker was a bit rushed and not very helpful.   Pork and Chive Dumpling: The wrapper had a gummy texture and doughy taste. The sauce was typically good but with out any spice. The filling seems okay but was overpowered by the taste of the wrapper.  Sweet Pork Belly Dumpling: The won ton wrapper used was much better. The filling had much more flavor and meatiness to it. The sauce was very powerful, strong garlic flavor (love garlic) but was pretty salty (could use a little sugar or chili oil to balance).   Steam Bao: The dough was dense and firm when not light and tender the bun ionly detracted from the sandwich. The Pork Belly was very flavorful but was cooked until firm and dry. Pork belly is at it's best with fully cooked yet tender, juicy and succulent. It should literally fall apart and melt in the mouth.

B535hfY9SQ4M618aIql7yg.text: Amazing! Been a long time since I had dumplings that good. We had the chicken and mushroom dumplings and the pork and chive dumplings. Spiced just right, tender dumplings, and just the right amount of filling. Can't wait to try the sweet pork belly next time.

dSay0EPZTghl1TG1dVY-8g.text: Dumpling Lady you know the way to my heart...*stomach!  Located in the heart of Noda, this food truck is located in the same parking lot as Smelly Cat Coffee and The Company Store. Craft coffee, Craft beer, hand Crafted dumplings for the trifecta!  I tell myself every time I go that this will be the time that I try the Noodles, but those dumplings are so darn good that I make a knee-jerk decision and switch at the last minute every single time. My favorite dumpling combinations is Sweet Pork Belly and Chicken & Shrimp. They cover the dumplings in a sauce made from ingredients from "the mountains of Sichuan/fields of NC". No idea what that means, I do know it's amazeballs (I've been witness to my husband drinking it straight from the tin...a few beers may or may not have been a contributing factor lol).

qKSNDUWwmGlnTaAT91Q6Vw.text: Definitely worth standing in line at 11am in the blistering Charlotte heat! The Dumpling Lady is a food truck that will sit in front of One Wells Fargo on Friday at 11-2 (right outside the entrance, you can't possibly miss it), but definitely get there early -- I arrived at 10:45 and there was already a line of people waiting! However, once they open they move fast! It helps that they have plenty of menus that are passed down the line, so by the time you're at the window, you're not going "ummmmmm I don't know what I want".  The $12 lunch special is filling and a good bang for your buck -- you get 1 noodle and 6 dumplings. (You normally get 9 dumplings in a dumpling order, but I don't think I could eat 9 dumplings and the noodles in one go.) I chose the Dan Dan noodles -- a Sichuan specialty -- and some sweet pork belly dumplings. The Dan Dan noodles were perfectly spicy -- definitely mix the noodles, beef, and sauce before you partake or you won't get the full experience! The sweet pork belly dumplings were surprising as I expected a traditional potsticker style dumpling instead of the shumai style dumplings that you would get at a dim sum restaurant, but the wrappers were done well (not thick and not soggy) and the filling had a light five-spice taste to them, which complemented the sauce. And definitely get the sauce on top -- it's spicy and complements the food well.  The one thing that I would warn about is that unlike some food trucks, this one doesn't sell beverages (or at least, I didn't see any offered on the menu). But I'll definitely be back the next time the truck rolls around in Uptown to get my dumpling and noodle fix!

wtCcYepRRo7Ssh8OFJeDrA.text: I give this a high 2, almost a 3 due to customer service.   Disclaimer: I am a self-appointed dumpling snob. I'm from Taiwan.   Moving onto the review..   My boyfriend told me about this food truck that comes to NoDa on Saturday afternoons so I was extremely excited - especially with the limited amount of authentic Asian food in Charlotte. Finally, the day arrived and I couldn't wait. I should also add that my boyfriend and I have been living a more vegetarian lifestyle but Asian food is usually pretty solid to that particular diet.. Lots of creative ways to eat veggies.   Unfortunately, out of their many options on their menu... Only 2 were Vegetarian friendly. One noodle dish and one dumpling option. That alone was very disappointing. There could easily be more mushroom based dumplings, for example.   Ordered a potatoe-veggie dumpling and I quickly realized that these are pre-made (understandably so), pre-frozen and tasted ...amateur. Skin of the dumpling was rough, wasn't reheated all the way through, very chewy and definitely NOT "fresh" tasting. The inside of the dumpling looked like mush. Very bland. The only saving grace was the sauce that the dumplings that are doused in. Now that - was probably the only good thing about my experience. (Mind you, we had 3 separate containers of these dumplings) I would not pay $9 again for cold, basic dumplings. Sorry :(  The noodles were ordered hot and arrived very cold. She said they were the last ones and could not be re-heated. I wish I had known that initially when we picked up the food but I digress. She was very nice though and gave us free dumplings. The noodles are something I would order again but only if they were piping hot.   ProTip:   follow her on Instagram: @thedumplinglady for weekly updates on her locations and times  if you are intent on trying her, I could recommend visiting her at the beginning of her shift instead of the later. Dumpling options start to dwindle and you might have better luck than I with fresher ones.

Q_HxdGiW0pnVfHjyPXyHpA.text: The food is incredible. I could eat these dumplings every day of the week.   We haven't had any of the scheduling issues that some other Yelpers have, we follow her on Instagram and it hasn't lead us wrong. The sauce is no joke, it's not an exaggeration, it's incredibly good. It is spicy, but not outrageous, definitely worth the heat (even my no spicy nothing Dad liked it!). Put another one down for saving the sauce and putting it on everything else at home. My fiance and I have tried to recreate it, and have been totally unsuccessful. I love everything about the dumplings. I think the sweet pork belly are my favorite. Followed VERY closely by the shrimp and chicken. The noodles I wasn't crazy impressed with, but I stick to the dumplings. The food is as locally sourced as possible, with spices shipped in from her hometown. We always buy three orders of dumplings for the two of us, one each and then one to share. I could just eat one, but then I'd want to order another.   I would agree that the service is not really warm fuzzy, but the food is so good that it doesn't bother me. We'd follow this truck all over town. Go by the Instagram schedule and you shouldn't have any issue.

4xxX7dHRDJCjhhTFYmT5pw.text: Wow we finally got to try this place after a few misses and now we are hooked!  It was great my only disappointment was the shrimp dumplings had chicken in them and I wish they were just shrimp. I also think a side dish of edamame would be a nice addition.  Their sauce was one of the best I have ever had!!!  We caught them at food truck Friday at Sycamore which was a nice addition to their line-up.

21myFSI4m5jb6TOi7eHhMA.text: This is one of my new favorite food trucks! The menu is very simple but the food is great. I did the lunch combo where you get noodles and a small portion of dumplings for $12.99- a little steep for lunch but it was SO much food so it was worth it in my opinion.   The dumplings are light, flavorful and have a great texture to them. I did the pork and chive and they were the best dumplings I've had in a long time.  The noodle dish was good, but way overshadowed by the dumplings (they were a tough act to follow). I had the Zha Jiang Noodles which were the less spicy option with ground sausage. The noodles had a nice, mild flavor and were very filling. The only changes I'd make to this dish would be more meat options like chicken and pork belly and more vegetables to balance it out.   Overall I really liked this food truck and will definitely return. The dumplings are the star of the show by far and id honestly recommend just getting a big serving of the dumplings for lunch! Next time I want to try the rice bowls and the bao buns.

omaQ_9hB6rnQVaz_jlrYDQ.text: Go to their facebook or instagram to find their locations and hours for the week! They tend to be open for lunch on the weekdays and dinner on the weekends. Noodles are $9 a bowl and dumplings are $10 for 11 dumplings. This is pretty steep but I guess their the only business of their kind in the area and they are a food truck so the higher price is expected. I got the pork and chives dumplings and the zhajiang mian, or black bean sauce noodles.   The dumplings were good and the sauce it came with was great, I added a lot of black vinegar though lol, but it didn't seem to have a big difference from the store bought dumpling I get. The noodles were similar, I think they are egg noodles, and had some strips of cucumber and other veggies. This was definitely not black bean noodles lol the sauce was completely different. I don't know if they just got the sauce wrong or if they're passing off these as black bean noodles.   We got a to go order and they were kind enough to pack the food and sauces separately for us which was great. I would say by and far the sauces are the highlight of their dishes. It is traditional chinese hot chili oil with some garlic, ginger, and spring onions. This is definitely home made and fresh and tastes amazing!   I'm not as sure about the actual food part, they are very similar to what I can get from stores but they were still very good in flavor. The prices are steep but I believe they have cheaper offerings during lunch. Definitely worth a try for some very authentic, for the area, chinese food.

zxsy6jHbcMp_Gw9nGJvDFw.text: These are the best dumplings I've ever had in Charlotte. Friendly owners and incredible food! The lunch combo is a great deal and I haven't tried and dumplings or noodles that I didn't love. Try it out!

8Q3zrgdaT7sz_CfL8I3hrQ.text: Holy Dumpling Batman!  A few friends tried some options from the Dumpling Lady while it was parked behind the Company Store in NoDa. For being one of the smallest food trucks in Charlotte, the flavors are big and bold!  I started out with the pork belly dumplings and they were delicious with wonderful flavors. I couldn't get enough of the coriander. But the problem was I wanted more! 10 dumplings just weren't enough so I went back for more. This time tried the chicken and crab dumplings as well as the beef noodles. I have to say both options were delicious but the beef noodles were my favorite. The spice level was spot on and exactly what I was looking for.  The staff is great here and they give you a pager so you don't have to hang around the food truck waiting for someone to call your name.   But one suggestion. I think the truck should be renamed to "The Fabulous Dumpling Lady".
